findings.description: The setAcceptedRoot function is intended for admin use but lacks any access control, allowing any user to set the accepted root.
findings.reasoning: This finding meets all the strict criteria for BONUS_VALID. There is a concrete exploit where any user can call setAcceptedRoot and manipulate the accepted root, leading to unauthorized token transfers. This does not require a compromised trusted role, there is no existing mitigation, it is in scope, it is not a design choice, and it has a material impact on the security of the contract.

target_assessment.type_match_reasoning: The analysis did not mention the target vulnerability related to the initialization of acceptedRoot.

notes: The analysis identified a valid critical vulnerability related to access control but did not identify the target vulnerability related to the initialization of acceptedRoot.
